meanings.definition: To remove or lose national status or character.
meanings.sent1: The family denationalized their traditions when they moved to a new country.
meanings.sent2: The company denationalized its branding to appeal to a global audience.
meanings.sent3: The confused penguin accidentally denationalized itself by wandering into the wrong exhibit at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her love for travel denationalized her sense of belonging to any one country.
meanings.sent5: The storm's destruction denationalized the landscape, erasing all signs of national identity.

meanings.definition: To transfer from national to private ownership or control.
meanings.sent1: The government denationalized the railway, allowing private companies to take over.
meanings.sent2: He denationalized the family business, turning it into a privately owned company.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel denationalized the park bench by claiming it as its own private resting spot.
meanings.sent4: The artist denationalized her artwork, selling it to a private collector from abroad.
meanings.sent5: The magician denationalized the rabbit, making it disappear from its national habitat.
